channel.title: R on Pete Talbert
channel.description: Recent content in R on Pete Talbert

item.title: Working more with the Baumann dataset
item.description: As a way to continue to teach myself statistics and learn new techniques (including some machine learning methods I am very unfamiliar with), I am taking Stanford’s self-paced statistical learning course.

item.title: Learning For Loops in R
item.description: I’m very much a beginner when it comes to any formal programming. So I feel like my first real practice should be with for loops, which are a staple of programming concepts.

item.title: Pivoting Data in SQL vs. R
item.description: Often with education data, I need to pivot data to go from long format to wide. For instance, I often have test scores for different test subjects of a single assessment.

item.title: Connecting to MS SQL Server in R
item.description: There are dozens of ways to connect to an MS SQL Server database in R. You can use a number of packages, and within those packages, there are various methods for connecting and running SQL queries via an R script.

item.title: Can I Write SQL in R Markdown?
item.description: Hello! This is my very first post; just a quick test as to how a SQL snippet shows in a markdown file and on a website. See below. select personID , endYear , grade , ROW_NUMBER() over (partition by personID order by endYear, case when grade = 'KG' then '00' else grade end) as rowNum from #enroll3
